Job description:

Customer Insight Researcher 

 

Hello! Thanks for stopping by. Let us tell you about all the great reasons to join us here at Yorkshire Water:  

 

 

Salary & Benefits 

 

 

We offer a competitive salary of ¬£34,857 - ¬£43,572 per annum, depending on experience.  

  

  • Annual performance related bonus   
  • Attractive pension scheme (up to 10% company contribution)  
  • Life assurance cover of 4 times pensionable salary  
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays ‚Äì plus an extra wellness day!  
  • A great benefits package ‚Äì choose from health cash plan scheme, critical illness insurance, dental insurance, life assurance flex and partner cover.   
  • Retail savings scheme   
  • Online GP service, cycle to work scheme, gym membership discounts and many more! 

 

 

Location:  Bradford/ Hybrid Working (a mix of office and home working) minimum of 2 days in the office  

 

Work type: Permanent. 37 hours per week, Monday ‚Äì Friday between the working window of 8:00am-6:00pm.  

 

We have an exciting opportunity for a Customer Insight Researcher to join the Customer Experience business area at Yorkshire Water and be a part of helping Yorkshire Water to provide the best service to our customers, by playing a vital role in customer research. Could this be you?  

 

What we do:‚ÄØ  

 

Everyone has an idea of what a water company does. Here in Yorkshire, we make sure that over 5.4 million people living in the region and the millions of people who visit our region each year, can rely on our services, and have clean and safe drinking water on tap and that their wastewater is taken away. But for us, it‚Äôs so much more than this.‚ÄØ 

We look after communities, protect the environment, and plan to look after Yorkshire‚Äôs water, today, tomorrow 24/7, 365 days a year. We provide essential water and wastewater services to every corner of the Yorkshire region, and play a key role in the region‚Äôs health, wellbeing, and prosperity.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

 New environmental legislation, unprecedented levels of investment and changing expectations from customers means that this is an exciting time to discover opportunities within the water industry. 

 

 

Where you fit in: 

 

 We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled research professional who will support Yorkshire Water in placing our customers at the heart of our business. This individual will provide robust customer and stakeholder insights to inform and shape the development and delivery of our services. Using both qualitative and quantitative research techniques, the successful candidate will be responsible for driving our ability to connect with and understand our customers through the latest customer and economic research thinking and techniques, while keeping abreast of new developments, benchmarking, and testing our capability. 

‚ÄØ Key accountabillities for this role include reflecting customer and stakeholder insights in a timely and consistent manner, commissioning, managing and developing‚ÄØ primary research projects, supporting the development, implementation, and delivery of our company and regulatory business strategy, collaborating with colleagues across the organisation, conducting focus groups and in-depth interviews with colleagues and customers, and ensuring a solid financial management and commercial awareness when making research decisions. The candidate will be able to apply their knowledge and experience of best practice when it comes to the management and execution of qualitative and quantitative projects, fieldwork and reporting. 

  

 

What skills and qualifications you will need:

 

 

  • Relevant experience or qualifications in research, economics, statistics, or marketing
  • Good experience of conducting and undertaking qualitative research techniques such as in-depth interviewing and focus group moderation in order to help leverage internal insight generation and ideation through stakeholder engagement and facilitation.  
  • Proven experience in supporting and embedding change, influencing and driving the right culture and behaviours, and the capability, energy, and tenacity to deliver sustainable performance against challenging business targets. 
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills, both written and oral, and with the ability to communicate and engage with people at all levels
  • Highly organised, able to manage conflicting priorities of multiple stakeholders 
  • Knowledge of the water industry and the regulated environment is desirable. 

 

 

We embrace a flexible working model, where our hybrid setup typically requires an average of 1 to 2 days in the office per week. This could be slightly more when collaborative efforts, training or meeting deadlines demand it. For those who prefer to work on-site, our office is open Monday-Friday during working hours.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

  

If you‚Äôre an experienced Customer Researcher and want to help us deliver exceptional service for our customers whilst protecting the environment, then apply today to find out what a career with Yorkshire Water can offer for you.‚ÄØ  

 

Please apply online and submit an up to date CV and covering letter outlining your suitability for the role.  

 

Recruitment Process:  

 

Closing Date ‚Äì 31st January, 2025 

 

We‚Äôre proud to serve the Yorkshire region and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the communities we serve. We‚Äôd really like candidates of all different backgrounds to apply. 

 

If you are offered the role, you‚Äôll need to undergo pre-employment checks, which include a Basic Disclosure Check, carried out through a Third-Party Company, prior to commencing employment. Depending on the role, you may also be required to go through the security vetting process for either a Counter Terrorist Check or Security Check clearance. 

 

 

Kelda Group reserve the right to close this position before the published closing date, if necessary. So you don‚Äôt miss out, be sure to complete and send through your application as soon as you can.

Title: Market Operations Analyst
Description:
Department Overview

At the Bank of England, we are seeking to attract and employ the best people by encouraging applications from candidates who reflect the diverse nature of the society we serve.

Be part of a Technology Monetary Policy (MP) & Financial Stability (FS) CIO Division whose platforms and products enable a digital and agile Bank for all, achieved with a diverse and talented division of technology professionals. Our divisional values represent the culture we drive:

Responsive and Agile
Collaborative and Connect
Automation, Automation, Automation
Rapidly Experimenting
Continuously Learning

Enjoy flexible working opportunities, a close community, genuine care for personal well-being, and a collective mission to promote the good of the people of the UK.

Systems & Solutions (SaS) is the domain within the Technology MP & FS CIO Division that develops, supports and maintains the data systems that are used across the Bank of England. Our core function is to analyse, design, develop and successfully deliver quality, robust business solutions. We are responsible for services that support the identification, extraction, analysis and presentation of business data to provide historical, current and predictive views of business operations.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job Description

We are seeking a Markit (S&P) EDM developer to join our MDM Product team. This is also a unique opportunity for the successful candidate to work with the business area who use the system on a day-to-day basis. We hope that combining your technical skills and developing business area knowledge, will enhance change delivery.

Utilise your technical skills and expertise to play a key role in the team's activities that include all phases of the software development lifecycle. You will work on multiple work-streams and be able to act independently, making decisions, applying analytical judgement and being an active member of the team.

We adopt a DevOps mind-set, and are responsible for the operation of the applications we deliver. Influence the testing and implementation of these components and provide post implementation support. Contribute to technical discussions, influence ways of working, share knowledge and provide technical mentorship to other team members.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a dynamic, high profile domain that offers a great platform to develop your skills and career.

Role Requirements

How you will make a difference

Be part of a robust team, forming strong and impactful relationships
Be able to demonstrate sound judgement, problem-solving and good analytical skills. Have the ability to handle and analyse a wide range of internal and external sources of information
Support all aspects of the data lifecycle, operating in an agile way of working
Quality, on time delivery of agreed deliverables
Flexible in working under changing and different work settings
Inputting into non-functional requirements (security, performance, capacity)
Provide technical input and support when engaging with other domains, teams and leads
Ability to communicate issues, status, and progress on assigned tasks to invested individuals (eg, Product Lead, Delivery Management, Product Owner etc)
Stay up-to-date on trends and techniques being used in the industry through research, and apply this knowledge to systems being developed
Champion and contribute to the continuous improvement of knowledge base, development processes, methods and standards
Have good interpersonal skills with an ability to interpret and present information to a variety of recipients using suitable modes of communication
Take ownership in reviewing work as well as participating in colleague reviews
Continually test your programs, correcting errors to maximise quality
Coach and mentor others - sharing knowledge/experience when appropriate
Have a positive 'can-do' attitude
Identify areas of optimisations
Invest time in professional and personal development

What we are looking for

Minimum (Essential) Criteria

Experience with developing in Markit EDM (version 11.5 upwards)
Understanding of Markit EDM and Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) development concepts
Understanding of Markit EDM Matcher, Load and Export, EDM UI
Experience creating user interfaces and error validation routines in Markit EDM
Understanding of batch scheduling system usage and implementation concepts
Proficiency in SQL and the use of SQL Server
Understanding of MSBI stack - SSIS, SSRS, SSAS
Experience of tools supporting the development and version control process, for example JIRA/Confluence, GIT, Azure DevOps - e.g. release pipelines, automation etc
Experience of Business Analysis skills in converting business requirements into technical solutions
Problem solving techniques, debugging scripts and writing stored procedures
A dedication to continuously learn new skills and apply this in relation to design, development, test and support activities
A team member who takes pride in the work they deliver and their contribution to the team

Desirable Criteria

Experience of using Control-M tool
Experience of using Powershell (scripting languages)
Familiarity with data warehouse design and usage
Understanding of data modelling and logical / physical database design
Understanding of financial instruments, particularly Fixed Income Bonds

Our Approach to Inclusion
The Bank values diversity, equity and inclusion. We play a key role in maintaining monetary and financial stability, and to do that effectively, we believe we need a workforce that reflects the society we serve.

At the Bank of England, we want all colleagues to feel valued and respected, so we're working hard to build an inclusive culture which supports people from all backgrounds and communities to be at their best at work. We celebrate all forms of diversity, including (but not limited to) age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, race, religion, sexual orientation and socioeconomic status. We believe that it's by drawing on different perspectives and experiences that we'll continue to make the best decisions for the public.

We welcome applications from individuals who work flexibly, including job shares and part time working patterns. We've also partnered with external organisations to support us in making adjustments for candidates and employees in the recruitment process where they're needed.

For most roles where work can be carried out at home, we aim for colleagues to spend half of their time in the office, with a minimum of 40% per month. Subject to that minimum requirement, individuals and managers should work together to find what works best for them, their team and stakeholders.

Finally, we're proud to be a member of the Disability Confident Scheme. If you wish to apply under this scheme, you should check the box in the 'Candidate Personal Information' under the 'Disability Confident Scheme' section of the application.

Salary and Benefits Information
We encourage flexible working, part time working and job share arrangements. Part time salary and benefits will be on a pro-rated basis as appropriate.

This role offers a salary of:


Leeds from ¬£36,000 - ¬£40,500 (depending on skills & experience)

London from ¬£40,000 -¬£45,000 (depending on skills & experience)


In addition, we also offer a comprehensive benefits package as detailed below:

A non-contributory, career average pension giving you a guaranteed retirement benefit of 1/95th of your annual salary for every year worked. There is the option to increase your pension (to 1/50th) or decrease (to 1/120th) in exchange for salary through our flexible benefits programme each year.
A discretionary performance award based on a current award pool.
A 8% benefits allowance with the option to take as salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits.
26 days' annual leave with option to buy up to 12 additional days through flexible benefits.
Private medical insurance and income protection.


National Security Vetting Process
Employment in this role will be subject to the National Security Vetting clearance process (and typically can take between 6 to 12 weeks post offer) and the passing of additional Bank security checks in accordance with the Bank policy. Further information regarding the vetting and security clearance requirements for the role will be provided to the successful applicant, and information about how the Bank processes personal data for these purposes, is set out in the Bank's Privacy Notice.



The Bank of England welcomes applications from all candidates, but as a UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) approved sponsor, we have a responsibility to comply with the Immigration Rules and guidance. As such, our ability to employ individuals who require sponsorship for immigration purposes is limited. The Bank cannot guarantee that you and / or the role you are applying for will be eligible for sponsorship and that any application made to UKVI will be successful. Eligibility will therefore be considered on a case by case basis.



The Application Process
Important: Please ensure that you complete the 'work history' section and answer ALL the application questions fully. All candidate applications are anonymised to ensure that our hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information, including your CV, when reviewing your application details at the screening stage. It's therefore really important that you fill out the work history and application form questions, as your answers will form a critical part of the initial selection process.


The assessment process will comprise of up to two stages.

This role closes for applications on 31 January 2025.

Please apply online, ensuring that you complete your work history and answer ALL the application questions fully and in detail as your application will not be considered if all mandatory questions are not fully completed.

Title: Operations Analyst - 12 month FTC
Description:
Location: Chatham/Bradford/Petersfield

Closing Date: Friday 31 January 2025

Operations Analyst - 12 Month FTC

Location: Chatham, Bradford or Petersfield

Working Pattern: Our working style is hybrid, but we recognise the importance of collaborative working with our colleagues often 1 to 3 days per week in one of our offices.

Benefits: Discretionary annual bonus, 25 days holiday up to 30 days (depending on service), pension scheme with matched company contributions up to 10%, 2 paid days to ‚Äògive back‚Äô, enhanced maternity pay (once successfully passing probation), 4 weeks paid paternity, LinkedIn Learning for all, Snoop Premium, Private Medical Insurance

Don‚Äôt hesitate to apply for a role even if you don‚Äôt meet all the criteria; your unique strengths and eagerness to learn can be just as valuable.

At Vanquis we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered. We believe that diverse perspectives drive innovation and success. This role is not customer facing so is especially good for those requiring flexibility of working patterns.

Job Description: As an Operations Analyst you will be reporting into the Strategy Manager in Customer Operations Strategy. We are seeking a talented Analyst to join our dynamic team. This is a varied role working across diverse teams on making improvements to the services and experiences we offer our customers. As a department we collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyse data, generate insights, propose and implement customer improvement solutions and support decision-making processes. Your work will be pivotal to the support of our customers and our strategic initiatives to help us achieve our goals. The role requires individuals who are exceptional problem-solvers, tactical thinkers, organised, and highly skilled communicators.

The role requires individuals who are innovative problem-solvers, tactical thinkers, solution focussed, organised, customer centric and skilled communicators.

Key Responsibilities:


Providing management with analytical insight, performance reporting, forecasting, and ensuring best practice in all projects and programmes. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports
Participate and support in customer improvement strategies and projects by articulating and developing solutions to address varied customer scenarios
Ensure all deployed strategies, solutions, and processes are adequately documented with appropriate controls, governance, and risks recorded
Support data-driven decision-making across the organization


What will make you stand out?


Proficiency in data analytics tools (e.g. SQL, Power BI, Snowflake, Python)
Attention to detail
Able to analyse complex problems and data to generate effective solutions for the business
Customer-centric solutions architect
Dynamic approach to problem-solving
Ability to understand technical processes
Ability to break down large problems and communicate them to a non-technical audience


Why Join Us:


Flexible Working Hours: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements.
Career Development: We provide opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth, including mentorship programs and training sessions.
Inclusive Culture: We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. Our diversity and inclusion initiatives ensure that all voices are heard and valued.


This is what our people say:

‚Äú It's been over 10 years since I joined Vanquis, and it has truly been an enriching experience. Currently, I am an Operations Analyst in the Customer Operations Strategy team. Before this, I spent eight years in the Fraud Department while balancing my job working part-time and looking after my children.

Transitioning to an analyst role over two years ago was a new and exciting challenge for me. Initially, the world of analysis and technical skills were unfamiliar, but within a few months, I was involved in various projects. This exposure was invaluable as a new starter. Throughout my career, I've held different positions, but I realized that the most satisfying aspect of each role was the analytical work. I love solving problems, digging into root causes, and developing creative solutions.

The Customer Operations Strategy team is fantastic, fostering a friendly, team-oriented environment that encourages a healthy work-life balance. Vanquis has provided numerous learning opportunities, including external courses like SAS certification and unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning. Additionally, they support my personal growth by offering paid time off to volunteer for charities and organizations of my choice.‚Äù - SM, Operations Analyst

‚ÄúI started my career at Vanquis straight from sixth form in a telephony role in Customer Service, after 8 years and great dedication I have recently became a Strategy Assurance Lead Analyst. My journey has consisted of a number of roles, opening up opportunities within Process & Change and Remediation. This is a great company for building a career in analytics. There is a constant strive to learn and continuously improve, both personally and as a company, with the best support network and opportunities to progress.‚Äù ‚Äì AC, Strategy Assurance Lead Analyst.

How to Apply: If you are passionate about data and excited to contribute to a diverse and innovative team, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your application, CV and a cover letter detailing your experience and why you are a great fit for this role.

The interview process:


Initial Telephone interview to discuss the role and find out a bit about you.
Up to 1 hour competency-based interview with the hiring team, including an assessment task.


Our average process takes up to 4 weeks, but we will always work around your availability. You will have the chance to speak to our recruitment team throughout the process.

As this role involves working within a regulated environment any offer will be subject to satisfactory background checks including criminal record check, credit check, fraud check and employment references.

Your working life: If you prefer to work part-time, we'll make this happen whenever we can - whether this is to help you meet other commitments or strike a great work-life balance. A fear of losing your current working flexibility shouldn't hinder you from applying for new opportunities, which is why we aim to match your existing flexible working arrangements where possible.

Why work for us?

We‚Äôre Vanquis Banking Group plc, an FTSE All Share company and a leading specialist bank, established in 1880. We lend responsibly, providing tailored products and services to 1.75 million UK customers through Vanquis, Moneybarn, and Snoop. Our purpose is simple: to deliver caring banking so our customers can make the most of life‚Äôs opportunities.

At Vanquis Banking Group we believe in looking after our colleagues, so we do our best to create a rewarding, engaging, and supportive work environment across our various divisions.

We let our colleagues know we appreciate their hard work by offering competitive salaries, benefits, and a Group wide recognition scheme. All colleagues are eligible to join a pension scheme, and, after six months‚Äô service, you can join our 'Buy as you Earn' schemes.

We offer a range of training and development opportunities to help each of our colleagues maximise their potential, whatever their role. From your first day working with us, we‚Äôll help you settle into your new role and are happy to talk to you about your career aspirations.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Here at Vanquis Banking Group, we embrace everyone‚Äôs unique strengths and identities to be themselves at work. Regardless of how you identify yourself, your sexual orientation, martial or civil partner status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national background, faith, disability, or age ‚Äì your experiences and background help enrich our teams, and most importantly help support our customers in the best way possible. At the end of the day, it's our people that help us to fulfil the reason why we‚Äôre here in the first place: to help put people on a path to a better everyday life.

If there‚Äôs anything we can do in the recruitment process to help you achieve your best, get in touch. Whether it‚Äôs a copy of our application form in another format or additional assistance, we‚Äôre available to help. You can contact us at Careers@Vanquis.com

Title: Retail MI Development Analyst
Description:
As our Retail MI Development Analyst you will be an integral part of the Retail MI Development team, dedicated to creating innovative, high-quality Management Information (MI) to support the Retail Team. Your role will focus on reporting for online, in-flight and third party retail revenue streams , as well as delivering bespoke reporting solutions to meet specific business needs.

As a member of the wider Retail team, you‚Äôll collaborate with the In-flight and Direct Retail Trading, Customer Experience and Product, In-flight Supply, and ROC Operations teams to help colleagues derive valuable insights from their data. Additionally, you‚Äôll be encouraged to participate in activities that enhance your data visualization skills and overall data fluency.

As our Retail MI Development Analyst, you‚Äôll have access to a wide range of benefits including:


Hybrid working (we‚Äôre in the office 2 days per week)
Access to a generous discretionary profit share scheme
Colleague discounts on Jet2.com and Jet2holidays flights



What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Gathering and collating reporting requirements from the wider team to inform data discovery and drive reporting innovation.
Leveraging SQL through Snowflake and HEX platforms to innovate data sourcing processes.
Designing and delivering impactful data visualization projects and dashboards using Tableau Desktop and HEX.
Actively engaging in internal and external training opportunities to enhance your visualization skills and data fluency.



What You‚Äôll Have


Proficiency in Excel.
SQL experience (desirable but not essential).
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong ability to present data visualizations and dashboards to key stakeholders.
Excellent communication skills to convey technical concepts effectively to diverse audiences.
A passion for analytics and continuous learning.



Join us as we redefine travel experiences and create memories for millions of passengers. At Jet2.com and Jet2holidays, your potential has no limits. Apply today and let your career take flight!
